title: Reflection - two mirrors joined at 130 degrees

content.question: Two flat mirrors, Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are joined together and meet at an angle of <math alttext="130 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>130</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, as shown in the figure. A light ray is incident on Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> at an angle of <math alttext="20 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mo>°</mo></math> from the mirror’s surface. The ray is reflected from Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and is then incident on Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, where it is reflected a second time. What is the angle between the final reflected ray and the surface of Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?
